VPTeX
Class VpLex

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--VPTeX.VpLex
public class VpLex
extends java.lang.Object

VpLex helps to split up program structures into subStructures and tokens. Is specialized to deal with VectorPascal code (backwards compatible with earlier versions of Pascal).

have

public boolean have(char c)
Skips the caracter c if it occurs at the current position (or after some space in the 'input' string.
Returns:
boolean - true iff the string was found (and hence skipped).

have

public boolean have(java.lang.String s)
Skips the string s if it occurs at the current position (or after some space) in the 'input' string. If s is an identifier (valid identifier syntax), immediately followed by a valid identifier-character, then false is returned (since there is something else and longer here), and nothing is skipped.
Returns:
boolean - true iff the string was found (and hence skipped).

isIdentifier

public static boolean isIdentifier(java.lang.String s)
Tests whether the given string is a valid Vector Pascal identifier.
Parameters:
s - the string to test for
Returns:
- whether or not s is an identifier

justSpace

public static boolean justSpace(java.lang.String s)
Tests if the given string is just space (i.e ' ' or '\t').
Parameters:
s - the String to look in.
Returns:
boolean - True if there is nothing but spaces or tabs in the string

mustBe

public void mustBe(java.lang.String s)
            throws SyntaxError
Skips the string s if it occurs at the current position (or after some space) in the 'input' string. Throws SyntaxError if the string wasn't found or if some longer identifier is found (c.f. 'public String have' above).

numeric

public boolean numeric()
Is character at colInd a numeric ('0'..'9')?

skipTo

public java.lang.String skipTo(char ch)
Skips everything up to the character ch and returns everything that was skipped. If the character wasn't found then null is returned.
Parameters:
ch - the character to skip to.
Returns:
String - everything that was skipped.

skipTo

public java.lang.String skipTo(java.lang.String s)
Skips everything up to the string s and returns everything that was skipped.
Parameters:
s - the String to skip to.
Returns:
String - everything that was skipped. If the String wasn't found then null is returned.

skipTo

public java.lang.String skipTo(char[] chs)
Skips everything up to the first occurance of any of the characters in chs and returns everything that was skipped.
Parameters:
chs - the characters to skip to (the first occurance of).
Returns:
String - everthing that was skipped.

skipTo_within_nonNestedScope

public java.lang.String skipTo_within_nonNestedScope(char separator)
Moves to the first occurance of 'separator' or to the end of the scope (which is recognised by '']' or '')'. Moves past any skopes that are nested within the current scope. Scopes are started by '(' or '[' and ended by ')' or ']'. Moves past any quotes in this scope.
Parameters:
separator - the character to stop at.
Returns:
String - the String that the lexer moved past. Return null if the 'separator' isn't found.

skipTo_within_nonNestedScope

public java.lang.String skipTo_within_nonNestedScope(java.lang.String separator)
Moves to the first occurance of 'separator' or to the end of the scope (which is recognised by '']' or '')'. Moves past any skopes that are nested within the current scope. Scopes are started by '(' or '[' and ended by ')' or ']'. Moves past any quotes in this scope.
Parameters:
separator - the character to stop at.
Returns:
String - the String that the lexer moved past. Return null if the 'separator' isn't found.

Moves past an arbitrary-length sequence of spaces and tabs ' '.

- the rest of the input String.
